title: Dragon Ball Z Remastered Episodes 1-68[Eng+Jap]x264-XP17
description:
***VIDEO***
Codec:                 H264
Resolution:            854 x 480
Frames Per Second:     23.976
Average bitrate:       609 kb/s

***AUDIO***
Codec: Opus

Track 1
English with Japanese music
6ch
Average bitrate: 108 kb/s

Track 2
English with FUNimation music
Stereo
Average bitrate: 65 kb/s

Track 3
Japanese
Mono
Average bitrate: 32 kb/s

Subtitles included.

Encode date: 6/19/2015

***PLAYBACK***

Download and install K-Lite Mega Codec Pack. It'll come with Media Player Classic which is the recommended player. It should work natively on all other players too.


***DESCRIPTION***

So this release has nothing to do with the group because everything was done individually with no oversight. It's an experimental project ripped straight from the new remastered Blu-ray to see how far an efficient, high-quality release could be pushed with all modern tools, as Dragon Ball Z episodes are notorious among filesharing networks, usually for being crappy rips with little attention paid to quality.
The remastered source has been stripped of all noise and finally redrawn to fit 16:9 widescreen rather than being cropped to fit widescreen like the shitty Kai so-called remastered release.
I'm disappointed to say that they used automatic algorithms for denoising and fixing film damage so the oversmoothing pretty much killed all high-definition detail. The videos were safely downsized to 480p without really losing anything.
Intros have been cut because they are all the same and a waste of space in the end.
Subtitles are included which are English subtitles of the Japanese dub. There were no subs of the English dub.
All my processing has been purely automatic with little intervention, thus there has been no thorough double-checking of quality whatsoever
